results.title: Jerry Lee Lewis, a Rock ’n’ Roll Original, Dies at 87
results.abstract: With his pounding piano, his impassioned vocals and his incendiary performing style, Mr. Lewis lived up to his nickname, the Killer.

media.caption: Jerry Lee Lewis in 1957. His incendiary performing style captured the essence of rock rebellion.

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Television;Colbert, Stephen;Fallon, Jimmy;Noah, Trevor (1984- )
results.title: Stephen Colbert Bans Kanye West From ‘The Late Show’
results.abstract: Colbert said his jurisdiction extended into the northern half of Times Square, and that he was “banning Kanye from coming north of Bubba Gump Shrimp.”

media.caption: “I have no excuses for why I didn’t do this before, except that he has never been on the show, had no plans to be on the show, we have never asked him to be on the show, and I’m not sure he’s aware that I have a show,” Stephen Colbert said.

results.title: Covid-19 Symptoms Can Rebound Even if You Don’t Take Paxlovid
results.abstract: A new study found that more than a third of those who recovered from an infection had symptoms recur days or weeks later.

media.caption: Rebound symptoms are common, said one doctor. “It doesn’t mean that things are going south,” he said. “It’s just the natural way the disease goes.”

results.title: Federal Judge Allows Activists to Stake Out Ballot Boxes in Arizona

results.title: Does the Constitution Guarantee a Right to Vote? The Answer May Surprise You.
results.abstract: For decades, the courts and Congress have taken the lead in expanding the legal right to vote, but the founders never explicitly included it.

results.title: Climate Protester Glues His Head to ‘Girl With a Pearl Earring’ Painting
results.abstract: The artwork by Johannes Vermeer, exhibited in The Hague, was the latest artwork to be targeted by protesters concerned about climate change. One person glued his head to the painting and another glued his hand to the wall.

media.caption: Johannes Vermeer’s painting “Girl with a Pearl Earring” joins Vincent van Gogh’s “Sunflowers” and Claude Monet’s “Grainstacks” as paintings targeted by climate activists.
